docs.snippet: The two groups are putting aside divisions to combat a wave of Islamophobia and anti-Semitism since Donald J. Trump’s election, and to resist whatever may come next.

headline.print_headline: Both Feeling Threatened, American Muslims and Jews Join Hands
headline.main: Both Feeling Threatened, American Muslims and Jews Join Hands

docs.abstract: American Muslims and Jews form new alliances after wave of hate crimes that followed election of Donald J Trump; groups like Sisterhood of Salaam Shalom and even Anti-Defamation League throw in their support of Muslim community, even going so far as to say they will register as Muslim if Trump and his advisers set up registry.

docs.snippet: Fall cooking has us ready for pies, stews and more.
Your daily look at late-breaking news, upcoming events and the stories that will be talked about today:
The 10 winners, which include the Brooklyn Laboratory Charter High School, will each get $10 million from the XQ Institute. It is backed by Laurene Powell Jobs, the widow of Steven P. Jobs.

headline.print_headline: Brooklyn School and 9 Others Win $10 Million Grants to Rethink Education
headline.main: $100 Million Awarded in Contest to Rethink U.S. High Schools

docs.abstract: Brooklyn Laboratory Charter High School is one of 10 high schools across country to win $10 million grant from XQ Institute, backed by Laurene Powell Jobs, to rethink educational approaches.

docs.snippet: Citizens are increasingly deploying social media in nations where corruption and abuse by security forces sometimes occur with few repercussions.

headline.print_headline: Africans Turn a Video Lens on the Police
headline.main: Inspired by the U.S., West Africans Wield Smartphones to Fight Police Abuse

docs.abstract: West Africans, inspired by videos that have depicted police killings and defined Black Lives Matter movement in United States, are increasingly using social media in countries where brutality by military security forces, open public bribery and other transgressions sometimes happen with little consequence; videos have not always produced tangible results like prosecutions, but have been greatly increasing public awareness.

docs.snippet: Homer Sykes photographed local festivals and ceremonies that call to mind unusual and obscure sides of British society.

headline.main: A Whimsical Slice of British Life

docs.abstract: Homer Sykes photographed local festivals and ceremonies that call to mind unusual and obscure sides of British society.

docs.snippet: Voters chose the former Green Party leader Alexander Van der Bellen, in a result that seemed to show the limits of Donald J. Trump’s populist tailwind.

headline.main: Austria Rejects Far-Right Presidential Candidate Norbert Hofer

docs.snippet: Taoyuan’s mayor said a Trump Organization representative discussed investment opportunities, a possible overture that could complicate U.S.-China relations.

headline.print_headline: Taiwan City Planning a Makeover Says the Trump Organization Showed Interest
headline.main: Taiwan City Planning a Makeover Says a Trump Agent Showed Interest

docs.abstract: Trump Organization denies meeting with officials in Taiwan to discuss possible investment in multibillion-dollar real estate development project in Taiwan; Cheng Wen-tsan, mayor of Taoyuan City, has asserted he met with Trump representative in September; critics warn such deals, either official or unofficial, will ignite tensions with Beijing and raise conflict-of-interest issues.
